item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Kort podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 14 - Perspektiver på personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description:
Kapitlet sammenligner centrale personlighedsteorier og vurderer deres styrker og begrænsninger. Det argumenterer for en pluralistisk, problemstyret brug af begreber og metoder. Hovedpointen er, at integration på tværs af forklaringsniveauer fortsat er fagets store udfordring.
Key points: - Intet enkelt paradigme kan forklare alle personlighedsfænomener. - Metodevalg bør følge problemstilling og analytisk niveau. - Dialog mellem teoriretninger øger begrebslig præcision. - Teoriers etiske og samfundsmæssige implikationer bør gøres eksplicitte.

item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Kort podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 8 - Personlighed, subjektivitet og historicitet · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description:
Kapitlet viser, at personlighed og subjektivitet er historisk situerede dannelser. Det kritiserer ahistorisk individualisme ved at forankre psykologisk liv i institutioner, sprog og praksis. Udvikling beskrives som socialt medieret under skiftende kulturelle betingelser.
Key points: - Historicitet er konstituerende for subjektets dannelse. - Psykologiske kategorier ændrer sig med sociale og kulturelle regimer. - Personlighed medieres gennem diskurs og institutionel praksis. - Analyse bør forbinde biografi med historisk forandring.

item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description: Alle kilder: Sammenligning af teorier og subjektets historie og eksamen · Emne: Sammenligning af teorier og subjektets historie og eksamen

item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Lydbog] · Grundbog kapitel 08 - Personlighed, subjektivitet og historicitet · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description:
Kapitlet viser, at personlighed og subjektivitet er historisk situerede dannelser. Det kritiserer ahistorisk individualisme ved at forankre psykologisk liv i institutioner, sprog og praksis. Udvikling beskrives som socialt medieret under skiftende kulturelle betingelser.
Key points: - Historicitet er konstituerende for subjektets dannelse. - Psykologiske kategorier ændrer sig med sociale og kulturelle regimer. - Personlighed medieres gennem diskurs og institutionel praksis. - Analyse bør forbinde biografi med historisk forandring.

item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Lydbog] · Grundbog kapitel 14 - Perspektiver på personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description:
Kapitlet sammenligner centrale personlighedsteorier og vurderer deres styrker og begrænsninger. Det argumenterer for en pluralistisk, problemstyret brug af begreber og metoder. Hovedpointen er, at integration på tværs af forklaringsniveauer fortsat er fagets store udfordring.
Key points: - Intet enkelt paradigme kan forklare alle personlighedsfænomener. - Metodevalg bør følge problemstilling og analytisk niveau. - Dialog mellem teoriretninger øger begrebslig præcision. - Teoriers etiske og samfundsmæssige implikationer bør gøres eksplicitte.

item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Elias (2000) · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description:
Elias links personality formation to long-term civilizing processes and changing social interdependencies. He argues that self-regulation develops historically with transformations in power, institutions, and everyday manners. The text situates psychological development within macro-sociological change.
Key points: - Subjective self-control is historically produced, not timeless. - Interdependence chains shape emotional standards and conduct. - Personality development is tied to social figurations. - Sociogenesis and psychogenesis must be analyzed together.

item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 14 - Perspektiver på personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description:
Kapitlet sammenligner centrale personlighedsteorier og vurderer deres styrker og begrænsninger. Det argumenterer for en pluralistisk, problemstyret brug af begreber og metoder. Hovedpointen er, at integration på tværs af forklaringsniveauer fortsat er fagets store udfordring.
Key points: - Intet enkelt paradigme kan forklare alle personlighedsfænomener. - Metodevalg bør følge problemstilling og analytisk niveau. - Dialog mellem teoriretninger øger begrebslig præcision. - Teoriers etiske og samfundsmæssige implikationer bør gøres eksplicitte.

item.title: Semesteruge 13, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 8 - Personlighed, subjektivitet og historicitet · (Uge 18 27/04 - 03/05)
item.description:
Kapitlet viser, at personlighed og subjektivitet er historisk situerede dannelser. Det kritiserer ahistorisk individualisme ved at forankre psykologisk liv i institutioner, sprog og praksis. Udvikling beskrives som socialt medieret under skiftende kulturelle betingelser.
Key points: - Historicitet er konstituerende for subjektets dannelse. - Psykologiske kategorier ændrer sig med sociale og kulturelle regimer. - Personlighed medieres gennem diskurs og institutionel praksis. - Analyse bør forbinde biografi med historisk forandring.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Kort podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 9 - Narrative teorier · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet forklarer personlighed via narrativ identitet på tværs af fortid, nutid og forventet fremtid. Fortællinger skaber sammenhæng, men synliggør også brud, konflikter og vendepunkter. Kulturelle fortælleskabeloner både åbner og begrænser mulige selvforståelser.
Key points: - Selvet opretholdes gennem kontinuerligt narrativt arbejde. - Narrativ analyse fokuserer på genre, plot og positionering. - Kollektive fortællinger former individuelle identitetsmuligheder. - Forandring kan forstås som omorganisering af livsfortællingen.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description: Alle kilder: Narrativitet, kultur og mening · Emne: Narrativitet, kultur og mening

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Lydbog] · Grundbog kapitel 09 - Narrative teorier · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet forklarer personlighed via narrativ identitet på tværs af fortid, nutid og forventet fremtid. Fortællinger skaber sammenhæng, men synliggør også brud, konflikter og vendepunkter. Kulturelle fortælleskabeloner både åbner og begrænser mulige selvforståelser.
Key points: - Selvet opretholdes gennem kontinuerligt narrativt arbejde. - Narrativ analyse fokuserer på genre, plot og positionering. - Kollektive fortællinger former individuelle identitetsmuligheder. - Forandring kan forstås som omorganisering af livsfortællingen.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Bruner (1999) · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Bruner argues that human meaning is fundamentally narrative and culturally organized. He links everyday folk psychology to how people interpret action, intention, and disruption. Narrative framing is presented as central for making persons intelligible in social life.
Key points: - Meaning-making depends on culturally shared narrative forms. - Folk psychology provides interpretive background for agency and motive. - Narratives normalize and problematize conduct through plot structures. - Identity emerges through storied interpretation of experience.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 9 - Narrative teorier · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet forklarer personlighed via narrativ identitet på tværs af fortid, nutid og forventet fremtid. Fortællinger skaber sammenhæng, men synliggør også brud, konflikter og vendepunkter. Kulturelle fortælleskabeloner både åbner og begrænser mulige selvforståelser.
Key points: - Selvet opretholdes gennem kontinuerligt narrativt arbejde. - Narrativ analyse fokuserer på genre, plot og positionering. - Kollektive fortællinger former individuelle identitetsmuligheder. - Forandring kan forstås som omorganisering af livsfortællingen.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · McAdams & Pals (2006) · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
McAdams and Pals propose an integrative model that combines dispositional traits, characteristic adaptations, and life narratives. They argue that personality science advances by linking universal tendencies to contextualized individual lives. The article offers a synthesis across biological, developmental, and cultural levels of analysis.
Key points: - Traits, adaptations, and narratives represent distinct but connected levels. - Personality explanation requires both structure and process. - Culture and development shape how dispositional potentials are expressed. - Integration across levels is a core theoretical task.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · X Raggatt (2002) · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Raggatt develops a dialogical approach in which personality is organized through multiple internal and social voices. The perspective treats identity as polyphonic, contested, and situated in communicative relations. Personality is therefore understood as dynamic positioning rather than singular essence.
Key points: - Selfhood contains multiple positionings that may conflict or cooperate. - Dialogue is both intrapsychic and interpersonal. - Identity stability is achieved through ongoing coordination work. - Methodologically, analysis tracks voice, position, and relation.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Bank, M. (2014). Narrative psykologier. I Køppe, S. & Dammeyer, J. (Red.) · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Bank introducerer narrative psykologier, hvor personen forstås gennem fortælling, tid og meningsdannelse. Kapitlet kontrasterer narrative perspektiver med træk- og mekanismeorienterede personlighedsmodeller. Identitet fremstilles som noget, der skabes i kulturelt medierede fortællepraksisser.
Key points: - Narrativer organiserer hukommelse, motiver og oplevet kontinuitet. - Livsfortællinger samskabes i sociale og kulturelle sammenhænge. - Analysen retter sig mod plot, stemme og positionering. - Psykologisk forandring kan beskrives som narrativ revision over tid.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 1 · [Kort podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 11 - Postpsykologisk subjektiveringsteori · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet omformulerer personlighed som løbende subjektivering frem for en fast indre kerne. Det analyserer, hvordan institutioner, normer og diskurser producerer bestemte subjektpositioner. Handlekraft forstås som situeret forhandling af positioner med mulighed for modstand og forskydning.
Key points: - Subjektpositioner er historisk og politisk organiserede. - Identitet er processuel og skabes i praksis. - Normalisering regulerer adfærd gennem personkategorier. - Forandring sker ved ompositionering i magtrelationer.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description: Alle kilder: Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori · Emne: Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 1 · [Lydbog] · Grundbog kapitel 11 - Postpsykologisk subjektiveringsteori. Problemet med personligheden version 2.0 · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description: Grundbog kapitel 11 - Postpsykologisk subjektiveringsteori. Problemet med personligheden version 2.0

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Gergen (1999) · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Gergen presents a social constructionist view in which psychological realities are generated in relational processes. He challenges individualist models by emphasizing language, culture, and coordinated action. The text argues that personhood is historically variable and pragmatically sustained in social life.
Key points: - Knowledge claims are shaped by communal practices and discourse. - The self is relationally constituted rather than self-contained. - Psychological categories are culturally contingent and revisable. - Theory should track practices that create shared realities.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 11 - Postpsykologisk subjektiveringsteori · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet omformulerer personlighed som løbende subjektivering frem for en fast indre kerne. Det analyserer, hvordan institutioner, normer og diskurser producerer bestemte subjektpositioner. Handlekraft forstås som situeret forhandling af positioner med mulighed for modstand og forskydning.
Key points: - Subjektpositioner er historisk og politisk organiserede. - Identitet er processuel og skabes i praksis. - Normalisering regulerer adfærd gennem personkategorier. - Forandring sker ved ompositionering i magtrelationer.

item.title: Semesteruge 12, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Hacking (2007) · (Uge 17 20/04 - 26/04)
item.description:
Hacking analyzes how human classifications interact with the people classified, producing looping effects. Categories in the human sciences can change behavior, self-understanding, and institutional responses. The text highlights the dynamic co-production of kinds, knowledge, and persons.
Key points: - Human kinds are interactive rather than merely natural descriptors. - Classification practices can reshape the classified population. - Institutional uptake stabilizes some categories and destabilizes others. - Ontology and politics of categories are tightly connected.

item.title: Semesteruge 11, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 16 13/04 - 19/04)
item.description: Alle kilder: Sociokulturelle teorier - socialkonstruktionisme og poststrukturalisme · Emne: Sociokulturelle teorier - socialkonstruktionisme og poststrukturalisme

item.title: Semesteruge 11, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Foucault, M. (1997). The Ethics of the Concern of the Self as a Practice of Freedom - Essential Works 1954-1984, Penguin Books. Vol. 1, s. 281-301 · (Uge 16 13/04 - 19/04)
item.description:
Foucault reframes ethics as a practice of freedom rooted in the active care of the self. Rather than universal moral law, he emphasizes historically situated practices through which subjects constitute themselves. The interview links truth, power, and subjectivation to everyday ethical work on conduct.
Key points: - Subjectivity is formed through practices, not simply discovered as an inner essence. - Care of the self is relational and political, not merely individual self-help. - Freedom is exercised within power relations through reflective transformation. - Ethics concerns style of life and practices of self-government.

item.title: Semesteruge 11, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · X Davies (1990) · (Uge 16 13/04 - 19/04)
item.description:
Davies develops a feminist poststructural account of the subject as discursively produced and positioned. She shows how language and social practices open and constrain available identity positions. Agency is treated as situated repositioning within, and sometimes against, normative discourse.
Key points: - Subjects are constituted through discourse rather than pre-social interiors. - Power operates through ordinary meaning practices and category systems. - Positioning can be resisted, revised, or strategically inhabited. - Gendered subjectivity is continuously negotiated in interaction.

item.title: Semesteruge 11, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 16 13/04 - 19/04)
item.description: Alle kilder: Køn · Emne: Køn

item.title: Semesteruge 11, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Bjerrum Nielsen & Rudberg (2006) · (Uge 16 13/04 - 19/04)
item.description:
Teksten analyserer køn som en psykosocial proces, der formes i samspillet mellem intime erfaringer og sociale institutioner. Feminitet og maskulinitet fremstilles som noget, der forhandles gennem livsforløb og historiske skift, ikke som faste træk. Analysen kobler identitetsudvikling til ændringer i familie, uddannelse og offentlig kultur.
Key points: - Kønnet subjektivitet dannes i mødet mellem indre liv og sociale forventninger. - Udviklingsbaner varierer på tværs af generation og klasse. - Normer for femininitet og maskulinitet er historisk foranderlige. - Identitetsarbejde rummer konflikt, ambivalens og løbende omfortolkning.

item.title: Semesteruge 11, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Bjerrum Nielsen, H. & Rudberg, M. (2006). Ytre og indre kjønn i forandring. I Moderne jenter. 117-149. Oslo · (Uge 16 13/04 - 19/04)
item.description:
The chapter analyzes transformations in gender identity by distinguishing outer social positioning from inner lived experience. It argues that contemporary gender formations emerge through tensions between institutional norms and personal meaning-making. A central claim is that modern gender development is plural, negotiated, and historically contingent.
Key points: - Outer and inner gender dimensions may diverge and be reworked across development. - Gender identity is shaped by family relations, peer cultures, and broader social change. - Normative frameworks regulate possible identities while leaving room for agency. - Psychological analysis must include both structure and biography.

item.title: Semesteruge 11, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Mitchell (2015) · (Uge 16 13/04 - 19/04)
item.description:
Mitchell revisits psychoanalytic feminism by clarifying how symbolic, social, and psychic processes interact in gender formation. She responds to poststructural critiques while defending the explanatory value of psychoanalytic concepts. The text argues for a non-reductionist account where desire, power, and culture jointly shape subjectivity.
Key points: - Psychoanalysis is used as a theory of subject formation, not biological destiny. - Gendered positions are reproduced through symbolic structures and social practices. - Feminist critique and psychoanalytic theory can be combined rather than opposed. - Political analysis needs to include unconscious dynamics as well as discourse.

item.title: Semesteruge 10, Forelæsning 1 · [Kort podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 10 - Kritisk psykologi · (Uge 15 06/04 - 12/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet introducerer kritisk psykologi som en ramme, der forbinder personlighed med samfundsmæssige betingelser og magt. Det kritiserer individforklaringer, der overser modsætninger i menneskers hverdagsliv. Personlig udvikling analyseres gennem deltagelse, begrænsninger og muligheder for forandring.
Key points: - Subjektivitet er socialt produceret og historisk foranderlig. - Problemer kan forstås som effekter af modstridende livsbetingelser. - Metoden bør følge konkrete handlemuligheder i praksis. - Kritik retter sig både mod forståelse og social forandring.

item.title: Semesteruge 10, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 15 06/04 - 12/04)
item.description: Alle kilder: Kritisk psykologi · Emne: Kritisk psykologi

item.title: Semesteruge 10, Forelæsning 1 · [Lydbog] · Grundbog kapitel 10 - Kritisk psykologi · (Uge 15 06/04 - 12/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet introducerer kritisk psykologi som en ramme, der forbinder personlighed med samfundsmæssige betingelser og magt. Det kritiserer individforklaringer, der overser modsætninger i menneskers hverdagsliv. Personlig udvikling analyseres gennem deltagelse, begrænsninger og muligheder for forandring.
Key points: - Subjektivitet er socialt produceret og historisk foranderlig. - Problemer kan forstås som effekter af modstridende livsbetingelser. - Metoden bør følge konkrete handlemuligheder i praksis. - Kritik retter sig både mod forståelse og social forandring.

item.title: Semesteruge 10, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Dreier (1999) · (Uge 15 06/04 - 12/04)
item.description:
Dreier analyzes persons through trajectories of participation across social practices. He argues that psychological phenomena are distributed across contexts rather than localized inside individuals. The text develops a practice-based account of subjectivity, learning, and change.
Key points: - Persons move through multiple practice contexts with shifting positions. - Meaning and competence are co-produced in participation. - Analysis must follow cross-context movement over time. - Subjectivity is organized through practical social relations.

item.title: Semesteruge 10, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 10 - Kritisk psykologi · (Uge 15 06/04 - 12/04)
item.description:
Kapitlet introducerer kritisk psykologi som en ramme, der forbinder personlighed med samfundsmæssige betingelser og magt. Det kritiserer individforklaringer, der overser modsætninger i menneskers hverdagsliv. Personlig udvikling analyseres gennem deltagelse, begrænsninger og muligheder for forandring.
Key points: - Subjektivitet er socialt produceret og historisk foranderlig. - Problemer kan forstås som effekter af modstridende livsbetingelser. - Metoden bør følge konkrete handlemuligheder i praksis. - Kritik retter sig både mod forståelse og social forandring.

item.title: Semesteruge 10, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Holzkamp (2013) · (Uge 15 06/04 - 12/04)
item.description:
Holzkamp elaborates psychology from the standpoint of the subject and critiques objectivist methodological reductions. He argues for concepts that preserve first-person relevance while remaining theoretically robust. The chapter reframes method as accountable to lived agency and social mediation.
Key points: - Subject science centers participants’ own reasons and conditions for action. - Methodological choices must match the ontology of subjectivity. - Qualitative and interpretive approaches gain systematic justification. - Critical reflection on abstraction is necessary for valid inference.

item.title: Semesteruge 10, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · X Mørch & Hansen (2015) · (Uge 15 06/04 - 12/04)
item.description:
Teksten anvender kritisk-psykologiske perspektiver på aktuelle danske diskussioner om subjektivitet og praksis. Den viser, hvordan institutionelle ordninger former muligheder for handling og selvforståelse. Analysen kobler samfundskritik til konsekvenser for psykologisk arbejde.
Key points: - Institutionelle kontekster skaber både begrænsninger og muligheder. - Subjektivitet medskabes i deltagelse og magtrelationer. - Psykologisk fortolkning bør inkludere sociale og politiske dimensioner. - Kritisk analyse sigter mod udvidet handleevne.

item.title: Semesteruge 8, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 13 23/03 - 29/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Critical psychology · Emne: Critical psychology

item.title: Semesteruge 8, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Holzkamp (1982) · (Uge 13 23/03 - 29/03)
item.description:
Holzkamp udvikler et grundlag for kritisk psykologi ved at sætte subjektivitet, samfundsmæssige vilkår og handlemuligheder i centrum. Han kritiserer individualiserende forklaringer, som løsriver problemer fra menneskers levede sociale relationer. Psykologisk analyse omorienteres mod betingelser for handlekraft og frigørelse.
Key points: - Subjektivitet er socialt medieret og historisk formet. - Analysen retter sig mod handlebegrænsninger og handlemuligheder i kontekst. - Psykologi bør undgå at reducere strukturelle modsætninger til private mangler. - Kritisk teori og empirisk arbejde skal informere hinanden gensidigt.

item.title: Semesteruge 8, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Tolman (2009) · (Uge 13 23/03 - 29/03)
item.description:
Tolman reviews key commitments of critical psychology and its implications for theory and method. The text emphasizes praxis, social critique, and the standpoint of subjects in concrete life conditions. It positions psychology as a discipline that should illuminate and transform restrictive social arrangements.
Key points: - Standpoint and context are constitutive for psychological explanation. - Method should track lived practice rather than decontextualized variables alone. - Critical psychology links diagnosis with transformative possibility. - Theory is evaluated by explanatory and practical relevance.

item.title: Semesteruge 8, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 13 23/03 - 29/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Critical personalism · Emne: Critical personalism

item.title: Semesteruge 8, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Lamiell, J.T. (2021) · (Uge 13 23/03 - 29/03)
item.description:
Lamiell advances a critical personalist perspective that questions reified trait entities and abstracted population claims. He emphasizes persons as concrete, historically situated agents rather than variable bundles. The argument calls for epistemic caution about what personality measures can legitimately represent.
Key points: - Person-level reality cannot be reduced to abstract trait scores. - Methodological individualism requires conceptual, not only statistical, rigor. - Population regularities do not automatically explain singular persons. - Critical personalism re-centers agency and context in personality theory.

item.title: Semesteruge 8, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Laux et al. (2010) · (Uge 13 23/03 - 29/03)
item.description:
Laux and colleagues discuss critical personalism as a framework for integrating person, action, and context. The text critiques over-abstract trait approaches and emphasizes situated intentional conduct. It proposes conceptual bridges between differential psychology and interpretive person science.
Key points: - Action is a key unit for linking person and environment. - Conceptual clarity is needed beyond measurement convenience. - Personality explanation should include meaning and purpose. - Critical personalism supports multi-level theoretical integration.

item.title: Semesteruge 8, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Lamiell, J.T. (2021) · (Uge 13 23/03 - 29/03)
item.description:
Lamiell advances a critical personalist perspective that questions reified trait entities and abstracted population claims. He emphasizes persons as concrete, historically situated agents rather than variable bundles. The argument calls for epistemic caution about what personality measures can legitimately represent.
Key points: - Person-level reality cannot be reduced to abstract trait scores. - Methodological individualism requires conceptual, not only statistical, rigor. - Population regularities do not automatically explain singular persons. - Critical personalism re-centers agency and context in personality theory.

item.title: Semesteruge 7, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 12 16/03 - 22/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Humanistisk psykologi · Emne: Humanistisk psykologi

item.title: Semesteruge 7, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Evans (1975) · (Uge 12 16/03 - 22/03)
item.description:
This text engages humanistic psychology through person-centered themes such as growth, authenticity, and relationship. It critiques restrictive models of the person and argues for experiential depth in psychological theory. Human development is framed as unfolding potential under supportive relational conditions.
Key points: - Person-centered perspectives prioritize lived experience and agency. - Relational climate strongly influences development trajectories. - Humanistic models challenge deficit-focused frameworks. - Growth is understood as contextually enabled, not automatic.

item.title: Semesteruge 7, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Giorgi (2005) · (Uge 12 16/03 - 22/03)
item.description:
Giorgi argues that humanistic psychology was a necessary correction to reductionist behaviorist and orthodox psychoanalytic models. He claims the field still relies too heavily on natural-science assumptions and needs methods that fit lived human meaning. The essay proposes a stronger alliance between humanistic psychology and phenomenology to study persons nonreductionistically.
Key points: - Humanistic psychology restored the person as a central unit of analysis. - Mainstream psychological methods can miss specifically human meanings and contexts. - Phenomenology offers methodical tools for rigorous, person-centered inquiry. - A core challenge is building human-science methods with epistemic credibility.

item.title: Semesteruge 7, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Maslow (1968) · (Uge 12 16/03 - 22/03)
item.description:
Maslow outlines a humanistic theory of motivation and self-actualization. He argues that higher-order growth tendencies emerge when basic needs are sufficiently secured. The text frames personality development as an ongoing process of becoming rather than fixed structure.
Key points: - Need hierarchies organize motivational priorities. - Self-actualization involves integration, creativity, and realism. - Pathology can reflect blocked growth conditions. - Human nature includes developmental potentials, not only deficits.

item.title: Semesteruge 7, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 12 16/03 - 22/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Eksistentiel personlighedspsykologi II (Bjerregaard-Nielsen) · Emne: Eksistentiel personlighedspsykologi II (Bjerregaard-Nielsen)

item.title: Semesteruge 7, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Cooper (2003) · (Uge 12 16/03 - 22/03)
item.description:
Cooper presents existential therapeutic perspectives focused on lived choice, meaning, and relational presence. The text integrates phenomenological description with clinical practice principles. It emphasizes collaborative inquiry into how persons inhabit possibilities and constraints.
Key points: - Therapy is an encounter oriented to meaning clarification. - Existential concerns organize many presenting problems. - Client agency is foregrounded within contextual limits. - Method favors dialogical exploration over prescriptive technique.

item.title: Semesteruge 7, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Jacobsen (2021) · (Uge 12 16/03 - 22/03)
item.description:
Jacobsen diskuterer eksistentielle og fænomenologiske bidrag til moderne personligheds- og klinisk psykologi. Teksten præciserer begreber til analyse af selvforhold, lidelse og forandring. Der argumenteres for metodisk pluralisme med afsæt i menneskers levede erfaringer.
Key points: - Eksistentiel analyse supplerer træk- og symptomorienterede modeller. - Begrebslig klarhed styrker både klinisk og forskningsmæssig inferens. - Mening, relation og temporalitet er centrale analysekategorier. - Psykologisk metode bør svare til sit ontologiske genstandsfelt.

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Eksistentiel personlighedspsykologi I (Funch) · Emne: Eksistentiel personlighedspsykologi I (Funch)

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Boss (1963) · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description:
Boss develops Daseinsanalytic perspectives that reinterpret psychopathology through modes of being-in-the-world. He critiques mechanistic explanatory models and emphasizes existential openness and restriction. Personality understanding is grounded in how existence is disclosed in concrete situations.
Key points: - Psychological suffering can be read as constricted possibilities of being. - Existential analysis prioritizes world-relation over intrapsychic mechanics alone. - Clinical interpretation tracks lived structure rather than symptom counting. - Ontology and therapy are methodologically connected.

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · May (1966) · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description:
May articulates existential psychology around anxiety, freedom, responsibility, and meaning. He treats personality development as confrontation with existential givens rather than linear adjustment alone. The text links psychological vitality to courage in the face of uncertainty and conflict.
Key points: - Anxiety is a structural feature of freedom, not merely pathology. - Responsibility and choice are central developmental tasks. - Meaning crises can be sources of transformation. - Existential analysis reframes symptoms within broader life projects.

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 1 · [Kort podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 4 - Fænomenologisk personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description:
Kapitlet udvikler en fænomenologisk tilgang til personlighed med udgangspunkt i levet erfaring og mening. Analysen flyttes fra abstrakte træk til person-verdensrelationer, krop og intentionalitet. Personlighed forstås som en situeret organisering af erfaring på tværs af konkrete livssammenhænge.
Key points: - Førstepersonsperspektivet er en central kilde til psykologisk viden. - Mening dannes relationelt i personens engagement i verden. - Metoden prioriterer deskriptiv og fortolkende stringens frem for reduktionisme. - Handlekraft og sårbarhed analyseres som samtidige vilkår.

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Fænomenologi · Emne: Fænomenologi

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 1 · [Lydbog] · Grundbog kapitel 04 - Fænomenologisk personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description:
Kapitlet udvikler en fænomenologisk tilgang til personlighed med udgangspunkt i levet erfaring og mening. Analysen flyttes fra abstrakte træk til person-verdensrelationer, krop og intentionalitet. Personlighed forstås som en situeret organisering af erfaring på tværs af konkrete livssammenhænge.
Key points: - Førstepersonsperspektivet er en central kilde til psykologisk viden. - Mening dannes relationelt i personens engagement i verden. - Metoden prioriterer deskriptiv og fortolkende stringens frem for reduktionisme. - Handlekraft og sårbarhed analyseres som samtidige vilkår.

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 4 - Fænomenologisk personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description:
Kapitlet udvikler en fænomenologisk tilgang til personlighed med udgangspunkt i levet erfaring og mening. Analysen flyttes fra abstrakte træk til person-verdensrelationer, krop og intentionalitet. Personlighed forstås som en situeret organisering af erfaring på tværs af konkrete livssammenhænge.
Key points: - Førstepersonsperspektivet er en central kilde til psykologisk viden. - Mening dannes relationelt i personens engagement i verden. - Metoden prioriterer deskriptiv og fortolkende stringens frem for reduktionisme. - Handlekraft og sårbarhed analyseres som samtidige vilkår.

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · X Moeskær Hansen & Roald (2022) · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description:
This text applies phenomenological analysis to contemporary questions of selfhood and psychological understanding. It emphasizes experiential structure, embodied perspective, and contextual meaning-making. The argument supports non-reductionist methods for studying persons in lived situations.
Key points: - Experience is structured and analyzable without reducing it to variables alone. - Embodiment is central for understanding affect and orientation. - Interpretation must remain close to concrete life-world contexts. - Phenomenological method complements but does not mirror natural-science designs.

item.title: Semesteruge 6, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · X Spinelli (2005) · (Uge 11 09/03 - 15/03)
item.description:
Spinelli presents an existential-phenomenological framework for understanding personhood and therapeutic encounter. The text examines anxiety, meaning, and freedom as basic dimensions of lived existence. It argues for dialogical, descriptive engagement rather than pathologizing reduction.
Key points: - Existential themes organize many forms of distress and growth. - Therapeutic understanding requires bracketed attention to lived world. - Meaning is co-constructed in relational dialogue. - Methodological stance shapes what can become psychologically visible.

item.title: Semesteruge 5, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Ricoeur (1981) · (Uge 10 02/03 - 08/03)
item.description:
Ricoeur examines how psychoanalysis can justify truth claims when its data are interpretive, transferential, and bound to the analytic situation. He argues that standard natural-science verification models are insufficient for psychoanalytic theory and practice. The chapter reframes proof through the relation between interpretation, treatment process, and the specific kinds of facts analytic work can produce.
Key points: - The central issue is what counts as a fact in psychoanalysis. - Theory, investigation, and treatment are epistemically intertwined. - Transference and interpretation are not noise but part of the evidential structure. - Psychoanalytic validation requires criteria beyond simple falsification models.

item.title: Semesteruge 5, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · X Freud, S. (1984-1905). Brudstykke af en hysteri-analyse (pp. 9-62, pp. 96- · (Uge 10 02/03 - 08/03)
item.description:
This case fragment illustrates Freud’s method of interpreting symptom meaning through transferential clinical material. It presents hysterical formation as compromise between unconscious desire, defense, and relational conflict. The text also exposes methodological and ethical tensions in early psychoanalytic case construction.
Key points: - Case interpretation links symptom form to conflict history. - Transference is central to both evidence and treatment process. - Narrative reconstruction is theory-guided and contestable. - The case highlights limits of early analytic authority and method.

item.title: Semesteruge 4, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 9 23/02 - 01/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Psykoanalytisk personlighedsstruktur · Emne: Psykoanalytisk personlighedsstruktur

item.title: Semesteruge 4, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Lacan (1966) · (Uge 9 23/02 - 01/03)
item.description:
Lacan analyzes subjectivity through language, symbolic structure, and desire. The text challenges ego-centered models by emphasizing the split subject and structural determination. Personality organization is treated as effects of symbolic positioning and identification.
Key points: - The subject is constituted in and by language. - Ego coherence can mask deeper symbolic divisions. - Desire is mediated through signification and the Other. - Structural reading reframes symptoms as signifying formations.

item.title: Semesteruge 4, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Laplanche, J. (1970). Liv og død i psykoanalysen (pp. 18‐38) · (Uge 9 23/02 - 01/03)
item.description:
Laplanche proposes a historical-structural reading of Freud that treats conceptual contradictions as theoretically productive. He argues that tensions in concepts like drive, ego, and object point to the object-problem of psychoanalysis. The text frames psychoanalytic theory as evolving through crises, reversals, and reinterpretive work.
Key points: - Contradictions are analytic resources, not merely errors. - Drive theory must be read through relations among aim, object, and process. - Theory development is tied to clinical and conceptual impasses. - Method requires sustained attention to latent structural tensions.

item.title: Semesteruge 4, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 9 23/02 - 01/03)
item.description: Alle kilder: Psykoanalysens personlighedsbegreb · Emne: Psykoanalysens personlighedsbegreb

item.title: Semesteruge 4, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Freud (1973-1933) DA · (Uge 9 23/02 - 01/03)
item.description:
Udvalget samler centrale freudianske formuleringer om psykisk konflikt, symptomdannelse og personlighedsstruktur. En dynamisk model udvikles, hvor ubevidste processer præger bevidst oplevelse og handling. Teksten forbinder metapsykologiske begreber med klinisk tolkning af kompromisdannelser.
Key points: - Ubevidst konflikt organiserer symptomers form og mening. - Psykens instanser forstås gennem funktionelle spændinger. - Tolkning søger forbindelsen mellem manifeste fænomener og latente processer. - Kliniske observationer og teoriudvikling belyser hinanden gensidigt.

item.title: Semesteruge 4, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Gammelgaard (2007) · (Uge 9 23/02 - 01/03)
item.description:
Gammelgaard diskuterer psykoanalytiske forståelser af personlighed med vægt på subjektivitet og relationel dynamik. Kapitlet præciserer centrale begreber og deres betydning for udvikling og organisering af personligheden. Psykoanalyse positioneres som en meningsorienteret ramme for fortolkning af psykiske konflikter.
Key points: - Personlighed formes i tidlige relationelle konfigurationer. - Konflikt, forsvar og fantasi strukturerer subjektiviteten. - Fortolkningsbegreber skal forankres udviklingspsykologisk. - Kliniske og teoretiske niveauer må læses i sammenhæng.

item.title: Semesteruge 4, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Freud, S. (1973-1933) EN · (Uge 9 23/02 - 01/03)
item.description:
This English selection outlines foundational Freudian claims about drives, conflict, and psychic organization. It models personality as dynamically regulated through interacting agencies and defenses. The material connects theoretical propositions to analytic interpretation of symptoms and dreams.
Key points: - Psychic life is structured by conflict and compromise. - Defense processes mediate between desire, prohibition, and reality. - Interpretive work seeks latent organization behind manifest content. - Metapsychological concepts are anchored in clinical phenomena.

item.title: Semesteruge 3, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Sharp & Wall (2021) · (Uge 8 16/02 - 22/02)
item.description:
Sharp and Wall examine personality functioning and disturbance through dimensional, developmental lenses. They discuss how impairments in self and interpersonal functioning relate to personality pathology. The text emphasizes integrating clinical utility with theoretically coherent models of dysfunction.
Key points: - Personality pathology is better treated dimensionally than categorically. - Self-function and interpersonal function are core diagnostic anchors. - Developmental trajectories help explain heterogeneity in presentation. - Assessment should connect symptom profiles with underlying functioning.

item.title: Semesteruge 3, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 8 16/02 - 22/02)
item.description: Alle kilder: Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality · Emne: Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality

item.title: Semesteruge 3, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Kandler & Instinske (2025) · (Uge 8 16/02 - 22/02)
item.description:
This review synthesizes evidence that personality differences are shaped by many small genetic and environmental influences rather than single dominant causes. It emphasizes that broad trait scores can hide specific mechanisms and that measurement strategy strongly affects what effects are detected. The authors call for multimodal, multi-perspective designs that model gene-environment interplay more directly.
Key points: - Personality architecture appears polygenic and poly-environmental. - Single-factor explanations have weak explanatory power for trait variance. - Operationalization choices influence observed genetic and environmental effects. - Future research should target interaction effects and person-specific pathways.

item.title: Semesteruge 3, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Lu, Benet-Martínez & Wang (2023) · (Uge 8 16/02 - 22/02)
item.description: Lu, Benet-Martínez & Wang (2023)

item.title: Semesteruge 3, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Volk & Puchalski (2025) · (Uge 8 16/02 - 22/02)
item.description:
Volk and Puchalski discuss evolutionary perspectives on personality variation and adaptive trade-offs. They frame individual differences as potentially functional responses to recurrent ecological and social demands. The argument integrates evolutionary logic with contemporary personality measurement.
Key points: - Variation can be maintained through context-dependent fitness trade-offs. - Adaptive value is conditional rather than universally optimal. - Evolutionary accounts should be tested against developmental and cultural evidence. - Trait interpretation gains depth when linked to ecological function.

item.title: Semesteruge 3, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Zettler et al. (2025) · (Uge 8 16/02 - 22/02)
item.description:
This paper revisits trait dimensions and their explanatory role using contemporary integrative evidence. It evaluates links between structure, prediction, and underlying mechanisms in personality research. The authors call for clearer theory-to-measurement alignment in trait science.
Key points: - Trait dimensions need both statistical and substantive justification. - Predictive success does not automatically identify mechanisms. - Model comparisons should include interpretability criteria. - Cumulative progress depends on explicit conceptual commitments.

item.title: Semesteruge 2, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 7 09/02 - 15/02)
item.description: Alle kilder: Person-situation interplay - stability and change of individual differences · Emne: Person-situation interplay - stability and change of individual differences

item.title: Semesteruge 2, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Bleidorn et al. (2022) · (Uge 7 09/02 - 15/02)
item.description:
This meta-analysis synthesizes longitudinal evidence on personality stability and mean-level change across the lifespan. It confirms substantial rank-order stability while documenting systematic maturation-linked change patterns. Findings refine earlier estimates and highlight developmental periods with stronger change dynamics.
Key points: - Rank-order stability increases into adulthood and then plateaus. - Mean-level change tends toward greater maturity on several traits. - Effect sizes vary by trait breadth and measurement level. - Large-scale longitudinal synthesis improves precision of lifespan claims.

item.title: Semesteruge 2, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Li & Wilt (2025) · (Uge 7 09/02 - 15/02)
item.description:
Li and Wilt analyze person-situation interplay in the expression and development of individual differences. They show how stable tendencies and situational affordances jointly produce behavior patterns. The paper argues for models that explicitly capture reciprocal dynamics over time.
Key points: - Behavior emerges from trait-situation coupling rather than either alone. - Situational selection and evocation can reinforce personality patterns. - Development involves feedback loops between persons and contexts. - Process-oriented designs are needed for causal claims.

item.title: Semesteruge 2, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 7 09/02 - 15/02)
item.description: Alle kilder: Personality traits, personality states, and personality dimensions · Emne: Personality traits, personality states, and personality dimensions

item.title: Semesteruge 2, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Columbus & Strandsbjerg (2025) · (Uge 7 09/02 - 15/02)
item.description:
This text examines distinctions and relations between personality traits, states, and broader dimensions. It clarifies temporal stability assumptions and context sensitivity in trait-state modeling. The authors argue for integrative measurement strategies that capture both enduring and situational variability.
Key points: - Traits and states should be modeled as connected, not opposed. - Temporal scale matters for interpreting stability. - Context can systematically shape state expression. - Dimensional models require explicit level-of-analysis choices.
Quiz: http://64.226.79.109/quizzes/personlighedspsykologi/W2L1/W2L1%20-%20Columbus%20%26%20Strandsbjerg%20%282025%29%20%5BEN%5D%20%7Btype%3Dquiz%20lang%3Den%20quantity%3Dstandard%20difficulty%3Dmedium%20download%3Dhtml%20hash%3D137cde55%7D.html

item.title: Semesteruge 2, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · X Zettler et al. (2020) · (Uge 7 09/02 - 15/02)
item.description:
The article evaluates trait structure and explanatory models in contemporary differential psychology. It discusses how latent dimensions are inferred and what kinds of behavioral regularities they capture. A key point is balancing parsimonious structure with substantive interpretability.
Key points: - Trait models depend on assumptions about covariance structure. - Measurement decisions influence apparent dimensionality. - Interpretation should distinguish statistical fit from explanatory depth. - Replication and cross-context robustness are central quality criteria.
Quiz: http://64.226.79.109/quizzes/personlighedspsykologi/W2L1/W2L1%20-%20X%20Zettler%20et%20al.%20%282020%29%20%5BEN%5D%20%7Btype%3Dquiz%20lang%3Den%20quantity%3Dstandard%20difficulty%3Dmedium%20download%3Dhtml%20hash%3D137cde55%7D.html

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description: Alle kilder: Personality assessment · Emne: Personality assessment

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Koutsoumpis (2025) · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description:
This article addresses contemporary challenges in personality assessment and construct interpretation. It examines how measurement choices affect validity, comparability, and theoretical conclusions. The argument stresses tighter alignment between assessment design and inferential goals.
Key points: - Assessment is theory-laden and not method-neutral. - Construct validity depends on clear conceptual operationalization. - Different instruments can imply different models of personhood. - Transparent inference criteria improve interpretability.
Quiz: http://64.226.79.109/quizzes/personlighedspsykologi/W1L2/W1L2%20-%20Koutsoumpis%20%282025%29%20%5BEN%5D%20%7Btype%3Dquiz%20lang%3Den%20quantity%3Dstandard%20difficulty%3Dmedium%20download%3Dhtml%20hash%3D137cde55%7D.html

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Mayer & Bryan (2024) · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description:
Mayer and Bryan discuss frameworks for evaluating personality assessment quality and scope. They compare conceptual and psychometric criteria for deciding what an assessment can legitimately claim. The paper emphasizes explicit linkage between model assumptions and use contexts.
Key points: - Assessment quality includes conceptual as well as statistical adequacy. - Use-case boundaries should be specified in advance. - Inference validity depends on model-fit to target questions. - Evaluation standards should be transparent and replicable.
Quiz: http://64.226.79.109/quizzes/personlighedspsykologi/W1L2/W1L2%20-%20Mayer%20%26%20Bryan%20%282024%29%20%5BEN%5D%20%7Btype%3Dquiz%20lang%3Den%20quantity%3Dstandard%20difficulty%3Dmedium%20download%3Dhtml%20hash%3D137cde55%7D.html

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 2 · [Podcast] · Phan et al. (2024) · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description:
Phan et al. argue that the nomothetic-idiographic distinction alone is too coarse for classifying personality research. They propose a 2x3 framework combining focal entity and type of generalization. The goal is clearer alignment between research questions, methods, and inferences.
Key points: - Nomothetic and idiographic labels are often conflated with method choices. - Generalization targets should be explicitly specified. - The framework supports transparent inference design. - Person- and population-focused approaches can be systematically integrated.
Quiz: http://64.226.79.109/quizzes/personlighedspsykologi/W1L2/W1L2%20-%20Phan%20et%20al.%20%282024%29%20%5BEN%5D%20%7Btype%3Dquiz%20lang%3Den%20quantity%3Dstandard%20difficulty%3Dmedium%20download%3Dhtml%20hash%3D137cde55%7D.html

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 1 · [Kort podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 1 - Introduktion til personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description:
Introduktionskapitlet kortlægger centrale spørgsmål, begreber og stridspunkter i personlighedspsykologi. Det sammenholder hovedtraditioner og viser, hvordan antagelser former metoder og resultater. Personlighed fremstilles både som mønstret kontinuitet og kontekstfølsom forandring.
Key points: - Definitioner af personlighed bestemmer, hvad der tæller som evidens. - Forskellige paradigmer prioriterer forskellige forklaringsniveauer. - Kontinuitet og forandring er begge grundproblemer i forskningen. - Teorivalg har både praktiske og etiske konsekvenser.
Quiz: http://64.226.79.109/quizzes/personlighedspsykologi/W1L1/%5BBrief%5D%20W1L1%20-%20Grundbog%20kapitel%201%20-%20Introduktion%20til%20personlighedspsykologi%20%5BEN%5D%20%7Btype%3Dquiz%20lang%3Den%20quantity%3Dstandard%20difficulty%3Dmedium%20download%3Dhtml%20hash%3D137cde55%7D.html

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Alle kilder · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description: Alle kilder: Introforelæsning og nøglebegreber i personlighedspsykologien · Emne: Introforelæsning og nøglebegreber i personlighedspsykologien

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 1 · [Lydbog] · Grundbog kapitel 01 - Introduktion til personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description:
Introduktionskapitlet kortlægger centrale spørgsmål, begreber og stridspunkter i personlighedspsykologi. Det sammenholder hovedtraditioner og viser, hvordan antagelser former metoder og resultater. Personlighed fremstilles både som mønstret kontinuitet og kontekstfølsom forandring.
Key points: - Definitioner af personlighed bestemmer, hvad der tæller som evidens. - Forskellige paradigmer prioriterer forskellige forklaringsniveauer. - Kontinuitet og forandring er begge grundproblemer i forskningen. - Teorivalg har både praktiske og etiske konsekvenser.

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Grundbog kapitel 1 - Introduktion til personlighedspsykologi · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description:
Introduktionskapitlet kortlægger centrale spørgsmål, begreber og stridspunkter i personlighedspsykologi. Det sammenholder hovedtraditioner og viser, hvordan antagelser former metoder og resultater. Personlighed fremstilles både som mønstret kontinuitet og kontekstfølsom forandring.
Key points: - Definitioner af personlighed bestemmer, hvad der tæller som evidens. - Forskellige paradigmer prioriterer forskellige forklaringsniveauer. - Kontinuitet og forandring er begge grundproblemer i forskningen. - Teorivalg har både praktiske og etiske konsekvenser.

item.title: Semesteruge 1, Forelæsning 1 · [Podcast] · Lewis (1999) · (Uge 6 02/02 - 08/02)
item.description:
Lewis examines the development of self-conscious emotions and their role in personality organization. The text connects emotion, self-evaluation, and socialization processes in early development. It argues that emotions like shame, guilt, and pride depend on emerging self-representational capacities.
Key points: - Self-conscious emotions require reflexive awareness of self. - Social norms and feedback shape emotional differentiation. - Emotion development contributes to self-regulation and identity. - Early relational contexts influence later personality pathways.
Quiz: http://64.226.79.109/quizzes/personlighedspsykologi/W1L1/W1L1%20-%20Lewis%20%281999%29%20%5BEN%5D%20%7Btype%3Dquiz%20lang%3Den%20quantity%3Dstandard%20difficulty%3Dmedium%20download%3Dhtml%20hash%3D137cde55%7D.html
